benchmark_details.name: MINERVA (Multimodal INterpretablE Reasoning Video Annotations)
benchmark_details.overview: MINERVA is a challenging videoQA dataset consisting of 1,515 hand-crafted questions and detailed, manually-annotated reasoning traces to assess multimodal models' ability to perform complex video reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating multimodal models on complex video reasoning tasks and to enable insights into how these models reason about video content.

data.source: Multimodal videos selected from platforms like YouTube, specifically chosen for their complexity and suitability for reasoning questions.
data.annotation: Manually created by expert annotators with guidelines providing complex questions, answers, decoys, and reasoning traces.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the ratio of correctly answered questions to the total number of questions.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates effective reasoning performance by the models evaluated on the dataset.
methodology.baseline_results: The best model, Gemini 2.5 Pro Thinking, achieved 66.2% accuracy, while human performance was at 92.5%.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through expert review and peer scoring.

harm: Potential misuse in assessment of video reasoning failing to capture diverse reasoning styles.
